content.description:
Stand start in between the two cracks of Freshly Squeezed and First Date. Climb straight up the very thin cracks to a big jug at the top.

 Both the cracks of Freshly Squeezed and First Date are a bit far of a reach, but don't use them cause they're off.
content.location: Tofu ascends big, crimpy jugs between the most prominent cracks on the path-side of the Lunch Break Boulder.

content.description: Sit start the same as Low Pressure. At first opportunity, traverse left into the gently arching seam/crimp rail. Follow this feature to the jugs at the top of Old Hat. Make the same full value topout as Old Hat.
Sit start the crack on the right end of the right face. Start with your left hand on a good knob/hold and your right hand in the crack.
Sit start the obvious crack on the left side of the left face. Gain the jug, and then continue up the crack. You'll reach some jugs at the top. Make one more final move to top out.

Sit start the same as for Freshly Squeezed. Gain the crimp rail in the center of the face (the same as Freshly Squeezed), and move right to gain the First Date crack. Continue past the First Date crack, and continue traversing in a good, rising, horizontal crack.
Sit start the crack. Ride the perfect crack until you need to make a tricky move right to finish.

Sit start the crack/corner feature with your left hand on a good hold low in the crack. Move up into the flake, and gain the crimp rail above roughly in the center of the face. Move left to the finger crack and navigate the remaining few moves using the crack and small holds in a seam off to the right to the topout. This has graceful movement on perfect holds! Classic!
Sit start the crack. Climb it to the top using good holds and really nice movement.

Sit start under the bulge with your left hand on a good, open hand hold on the left face and your right hand in the crack. Gain a sharp, slicer, vertical hold using a good pocket jug. Follow the crack on good holds to the final sequence rounding the lip while following the crack. Awesome!

This is a large, trailside boulder host to several fine crack and face climbs. The problems are of a high quality and are on the high side of things. Bring your head. Even though these may not be the hardest climbs in the vicinity, the topouts are tricky and demand a strong head. It is a great place to warm up for the challenges that await in The Playground and Lobster Trap. 

  I took the liberty of giving these climbs some names and leaving the FA as "unknown". It is likely some of this (if not all) has been climbed in the past. If someone knows if this boulder or the routes go by something different, just let me know.
